xs.description: Extra small radius (2px). Use for: small badges, tags, inline code blocks, tiny indicators, nested elements inside sm-radius containers. Barely perceptible rounding - softens without calling attention. Common in: chip components, status dots, code snippets.

sm.description: Small radius (4px). DEFAULT for small components. Use for: buttons, inputs, dropdowns, tooltips, small cards, table cells. The workhorse radius - professional and subtle. Most form elements use this. Common in: Button, Input, Select, Badge, Alert.

md.description: Medium radius (8px). Use for: cards, modals, dialogs, larger containers, image thumbnails, panels. Creates friendly, approachable feel without being playful. Common in: Card, Modal, Popover, larger interactive surfaces.

lg.description: Large radius (16px). Use for: hero cards, featured content, marketing components, prominent UI elements. Noticeably rounded - use intentionally for emphasis or friendly tone. Common in: feature cards, promotional banners, onboarding modals.

xl.description: Extra large radius (32px). Use for: hero sections, large promotional elements, artistic layouts, very large cards. Significantly rounded - creates soft, approachable aesthetic. Use sparingly - can feel too casual for business applications.

full.description: Full/pill radius (circular). Use for: avatar circles, round buttons, pill-shaped tags, circular indicators, FABs. Creates perfect circles on square elements or pill shapes on rectangles. Common in: Avatar, round IconButton, pill Badge, circular progress.

default.description: Default border radius when no size is specified. References radius.sm (4px) as a safe default for most components. Use this when a component needs rounded corners but no specific size is mandated.
